intro: Paederia longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed paederia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals, and appear in clusters. Paederia longituba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
